### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #19281 (test: fix dangling bitcoind in functional tests by S3RK)

If you consider this pull request important, please al

> It's not clear to me what is wrong with the kill+wait approach, why does it result in dangling processes.

So, we have three layers of processes, something like
```uml
test_runner.py[100] -> test_1.py[101] -> bitcoind[102]
                    -> test_2.py[103] -> bitcoind[104] 
```

Currently `test_runner.py[100]` sends SIGKILL to all `test_x.py` which leads to its immediate term

ACK 451b96f7d2796d00eabaec56d831f9e9b1a569cc. Manual testing with and without **--failfast**. Failing an assert with --failfast, passes through [reviewed code](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22249/files#diff-437d7f6e9f2229879b60aae574a8217f14c643bbf3cfa9225d8011d6d52df00cR556). When fails, exits gracefully stopping of processes.
Log
Example failure is here and looks good: https://cirrus-ci.com/build/5678106947092480\n\nCommit can be removed again.
